page.title: 15TEACHERS' ACTION_S.REIGATE
page.content: From March 1985 the teachers from England and Wales were in dispute with their employers.Teaching unions wanted a pay settlement equivalent to inflat_ ion rate plus a contribution towards restoring the 34% loss of earnings since the Houghton award.The employers offered various amounts all less than inflation rate and tied to worsened conditions of service.As a result tea_ chers of both main unions in maintain_ ed schools in our block withdrew good will.On one half_day in the months of September onwards withdrawal of labour was also employed.Teachers of NUT joined in a rally at Dorking Halls on Friday 6th December to mark a visit by the Secretary of State to De Stafford School,Caterham (later cancelled) when a petition signed by teachers of all unions or none was to have been pre- sented. Jan 1986 _ still in dispute.
